topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e349bd6368722a1b0f3000#post_54e349bd6368722a1b0f3000
Here is his entry under complete monster on TV Tropes

*Monster is dedicated to exploring whether there is such a thing as pure evil, or if anybody, no matter how heinous, can be redeemed. The series' conclusion is that while anybody can be redeemed, it is titular character Johan Liebert's refusal to seek redemption that makes him a monster. A sadistic chessmaster and manipulative bastard since he learned to walk and talk, Johan is on a personal journey to become, in his own words, as dark as possible, all while trying to find out if there is anyone as evil as he is out there, or failing that, force the heroic Dr. Tenma, and/or his own pacifistic sister, Nina Foertner, to kill him in cold blood. In this way, he hopes to establish that even the best people can become just like him. Along the way he convinces children to jump from rooftops, gets a recovering alcoholic drunk before throwing him off a building, and convinces various serial killers to murder every foster family he has ever lived with, as part of his quest to become an unperson. Numerous Freudian Excuses are proposed for Johan's behavior, yet each one is ultimately undermined, revealing that in the end, Johan simply is pure, unadulterated evil.!*
topics.author: 509f70a87f123b77eb0004fd
